tweet: Dear #Ontario,   We are a group of 200+ doctors & researchers highly concerned about the #COVID19 humanitarian crisis in our LTC facilities.   It’s time to end for-profit #LTC, immediately address the staffing crisis & legislate family caregiver rights into law.   #LTCjustice  https://t.co/dd0EQN6C6x

#BREAKING: 200+ doctors & researchers @Docs4LTCJustice sign letter calling on Ontario govt to urgently address the LTC crisis. We must end for-profit LTC, end the staffing crisis, & legislate family caregiver rights.  We demand #LTCjustice!

I am joining 200+ colleagues @Docs4LTCJustice to call on the Ontario government to address the LTC crisis. 3300+ seniors have died. Urgent action is needed to end understaffing, legislate family caregiver rights, & improve living/working conditions. Seniors deserve #LTCjustice!🚨  https://t.co/Osn0lYYq39

📣 BREAKING 📣 Myself, @AmitAryaMD, @NaheedD and 200➕doctors & researchers have joined together to call on @fordnation @DrFullertonMPP to take urgent action to address the LTC crisis.  https://t.co/J7rp9rGLkH

I stand in solidarity with the 200+ doctors in Ontario, calling on the Ford Gov to end for-profit longterm care, take immediate action on staffing and legislate caregiver rights. So many Canadians have lost their lives in LTC, it is time for that to end. #LTCJustice 💪🩺

Campaign is described as province-wide campaign to express doctors’ collective grave concern for the safety and well-being of Ontarians who reside and work in long-term care (LTC) homes.  #onpoli

A vital read on the grim consequences of a LTC system where greedy profit-making comes at the expense of quality of care.  New Democrats have a plan to ban all for-profits from LTC and build a fully public system, where every dollar goes into a better quality of life for seniors.

.@amazon delivery driver just spent 10min on his cell with me, running around my mom's LTC bldg, trying to figure out where to leave package I sent her, which is a small handheld radio for her to try to pass the time locked in her room during Covid outbreak. He's my hero today.💫

My grandma's LTC facility was vaccinated last week and are finally down to zero cases after months of outbreaks, so my dad can finally go visit her. She moved there during covid so knows no one and has felt very alone and scared. Today she will get her first hug in 18 weeks. 💕
